pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:5.1: 64. The training rule on lying down
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people who were lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:7.1: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone lying down who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:8.1: One should not give teachings to anyone lying down who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone who is lying down and who is not sick, even if they are just lying on the ground, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
